alert.note: Alert for Freeborn (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 12:13PM CDT until May 19 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Freeborn County in south central Minnesota... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 1212 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over London, or 9 miles southwest of Austin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Freeborn County, including the following locations... Myrtle. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
